file.content:
{
  "name": "react-ssr-worker-reference",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Successful React 19 SSR deployment reference for Cloudflare Workers",
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "vite dev",
    "dev:worker": "wrangler dev",
    "dev:worker:remote": "wrangler dev --remote",
    "dev:worker:nixos": "npm run fix-workerd && wrangler dev --remote",
    "fix-workerd": "patchelf --set-interpreter $(patchelf --print-interpreter $(which cat)) ./node_modules/@cloudflare/workerd-linux-64/bin/workerd || true",
    "build": "vite build",
    "build:client": "vite build",
    "deploy": "npm run build:client && wrangler deploy",
    "deploy:worker": "npm run build:client && wrangler deploy",
    "test": "vitest run",
    "test:watch": "vitest"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "react": "^19.0.0",
    "react-dom": "^19.0.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@cloudflare/vite-plugin": "^1.7.4",
    "@cloudflare/workers-types": "^4.20250407.0",
    "@types/node": "^22.14.0",
    "@types/react": "^19.0.0",
    "@types/react-dom": "^19.0.0",
    "@vitejs/plugin-react": "^4.3.3",
    "typescript": "^5.6.3",
    "vite": "^6.2.6",
    "vitest": "^1.6.0",
    "wrangler": "^4.20.5"
  }
}

content.content: <tool_use_error>File does not exist. Did you mean wrangler.toml?</tool_use_error>

     2‚Üímain = "src/worker.tsx"
     3‚Üícompatibility_date = "2024-09-23"
     4‚Üícompatibility_flags = ["nodejs_compat"]
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üí[assets]
     7‚Üídirectory = "dist/assets"
     8‚Üíbinding = "ASSETS"
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí[env.production]
    11‚Üíname = "react-ssr-worker-reference"

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

file.content:
name = "react-ssr-worker-reference"
main = "src/worker.tsx"
compatibility_date = "2024-09-23"
compatibility_flags = ["nodejs_compat"]

[assets]
directory = "dist/assets"
binding = "ASSETS"

[env.production]
name = "react-ssr-worker-reference"

input.description: Deploy using npm in development shell
